problem.markdown:
>>Thomas Malthus predicted that:<< (x) human population growth would outpace food production () advances in technology would offset population growth () resource distribution would not be a problem () agricultural productivity would decrease due to pesticide use () the impact of the Green Revolution would support increasing population size
[explanation] Thomas Malthus predicted that human population growth would one day exceed food production, leading to food limitation. The idea that the human population will one day exceed carrying capacity on Earth is known as the Malthusian View. [explanation]
